title: Egypt
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Egypt - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Family - Social aspects
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Children - Family relationships
description: Episode of Series "Families of the world". Join 13 year-old Mohammed el Sayed, who lives in Egypt's capital city Cairo, and learn about life in the Arab republic of Egypt. His father moved to Cairo from the country to find work and as we follow Mohammed's daily life, we learn about the way people live in such a bustling metropolis, as well as the Arab way of life. Of great interest if the importance of history, tradition and religion in the daily lives of the people of Egypt. Students will not only learn where the Middle East and Egypt is, but also to compare and contrast Mohammed's life with their own. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher's guide included.
related_objects: Series; S01347; Families of the world; Active; 1986
